data.title: GEOPOLITICS | Israeli Prime Minister Claims Iranian Supreme Leader Removed
data.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced on the evening of February 28 that there are numerous indications suggesting the removal of Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. According to Jin10, Netanyahu stated that the day's military operations had successfully eliminated several key figures involved in Iran's nuclear program. He emphasized that Israel will continue to target multiple Iranian sites in its ongoing efforts.

data.description:
Nvidia plans to launch a new processor designed to help OpenAI and other customers build faster, ‌more efficient AI systems, the Wall Street Journal reported ‌on Friday.
source: https://catenaa.com/industries/technology/nvidia-plans-to-launch-new-ai-chip-for-processing-speed/

data.title: Norwegian Prime Minister Urges Restraint and Diplomatic Talks
data.description: Norwegian Prime Minister has called for all parties involved in the conflict to exercise restraint and resume diplomatic negotiations promptly to seek a resolution. According to Jin10, the Prime Minister emphasized the importance of dialogue and peaceful solutions in addressing the ongoing tensions. The call for diplomacy comes amid heightened concerns over the potential escalation of the conflict. The Norwegian government remains committed to supporting efforts that promote stability and peace in the region.

data.title: Norwegian Prime Minister Engages with Maritime Industry Amid Hormuz Strait Tensions
data.description: Norwegian Prime Minister has announced ongoing communication with various Norwegian businesses, particularly those in the maritime sector affected by the situation in the Hormuz Strait and surrounding areas. According to Jin10, the Prime Minister emphasized the importance of maintaining close ties with industries impacted by geopolitical developments. The Hormuz Strait, a critical maritime passage, has been a focal point of international attention due to its strategic significance and recent tensions. The Norwegian government is actively monitoring the situation to support its maritime industry and ensure stability in the region.

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | Israeli Prime Minister Urges Iranian Citizens to Protest
data.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has called on the people of Iran to take to the streets and fulfill their mission. According to Jin10, Netanyahu's appeal comes amid ongoing tensions between Israel and Iran. The Israeli leader's statement is seen as a direct message to the Iranian populace, encouraging them to rise against their government. This development adds another layer to the complex geopolitical dynamics in the region, where both nations have been at odds over various issues, including nuclear capabilities and regional influence. Netanyahu's call is likely to resonate with those in Iran who are dissatisfied with their current leadership, potentially leading to increased unrest. The situation remains fluid, with international observers closely monitoring the response from both the Iranian government and its citizens.

data.title: Iranian Culture Minister Denies Reports of Upcoming Speech by Supreme Leader Khamenei
data.description: Iranian Culture Minister has refuted claims regarding an imminent speech by Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. According to Jin10, the minister clarified that reports suggesting Khamenei's upcoming address are inaccurate. This statement comes amid heightened speculation about potential political developments in Iran. The minister's denial aims to dispel rumors and maintain clarity on the matter.

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | Iran's Supreme Leader Takes Command in Operations Room Amid Tensions
data.description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has reportedly entered the operations command room to oversee military operations, according to Tasnim News Agency on February 28. This move mirrors his involvement during last year's 'Twelve-Day War' with Israel. According to Jin10, the decision comes amid escalating tensions in the region, highlighting Iran's strategic military posture. The Supreme Leader's direct involvement underscores the seriousness of the current situation, as Iran continues to navigate complex geopolitical dynamics.

data.title: BNB Surpasses 610 USDT with a Narrowed 0.25% Decrease in 24 Hours
data.description: On Feb 28, 2026, 18:47 PM(UTC). According to Binance Market Data, BNB has crossed the 610 USDT benchmark and is now trading at 610.099976 USDT, with a narrowed narrowed 0.25% decrease in 24 hours.

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | Israel Closes Gaza Crossings Amid Tensions with Iran
data.description: Israel has announced the closure of several crossings into the Gaza Strip following military actions against Iran by both Israel and the United States. According to Jin10, the Coordination of Government Activities in the Territories (COGAT) confirmed the closures, citing security concerns. This development comes amid heightened geopolitical tensions in the region, impacting the movement of goods and people. The closures are expected to affect daily life in Gaza, as these crossings are vital for the flow of essential supplies. The situation remains tense as regional dynamics continue to evolve.

data.title: Iran's Crypto Economy: A Lifeline Amid Economic Turmoil
data.description: Amid ongoing protests and economic challenges, Iran's government is increasingly relying on its $7.8 billion crypto shadow economy to sustain international trade. According to NS3.AI, this dependency underscores the vital role of cryptocurrency infrastructure in Iran's pressured economy. Meanwhile, ordinary citizens are also turning to cryptocurrencies as a crucial financial lifeline, reflecting the broader impact of digital currencies in the region.

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | Hormuz Strait Remains Open Amid Tensions
data.description: On March 1, Jin10 reported that the Hormuz Strait remains open, according to the UK Maritime Trade Operations. However, caution is advised when navigating the area. This follows earlier reports suggesting that Iran had closed the strait. As of now, Iranian officials have not issued any statements regarding the situation. According to Jin10, the Hormuz Strait is a critical maritime passage, and any disruptions could have significant geopolitical implications.

data.title: Labour Minister Resigns Amid Investigation into Think-Tank Activities
data.description: Josh Simons, a junior minister in Keir Starmer’s administration, has stepped down from his position. Bloomberg posted on X, the resignation comes as the government conducts an investigation into the activities of a prominent Labour think-tank that Simons previously led. The inquiry is focused on the operations and influence of the think-tank within the Labour Party. Simons' departure marks a significant development in the ongoing scrutiny of the think-tank's role and its impact on party policies. The investigation aims to ensure transparency and accountability within the party's decision-making processes.

data.title: Ethereum Price Movements Could Trigger Significant Liquidations
data.description: Ethereum's price fluctuations could lead to substantial liquidations on major centralized exchanges. According to ChainCatcher, Coinglass data indicates that if Ethereum's price falls below $1,809, the cumulative liquidation of long positions could reach $791 million. Conversely, if Ethereum surpasses $1,998, the liquidation of short positions could total $746 million.

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | Iran Claims Victory in First Stage of Conflict
data.description: Iran's Deputy Speaker of Parliament has announced that the country has officially won the first stage of the war, according to Jin10. This statement was reported by the Islamic Republic of Iran Broadcasting, highlighting Iran's strategic advancements in the ongoing conflict. The announcement marks a significant development in the geopolitical landscape, as Iran continues to assert its position in regional affairs. Further details on the implications of this victory and its impact on international relations remain to be seen.

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | Tensions Rise in Gulf Amid Iran-US-Israel Conflict
data.description: An unidentified projectile was seen streaking across the sky over Dubai Marina on February 28, as tensions in the Gulf region escalate due to the ongoing conflict involving Iran, the United States, and Israel. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the intensifying situation across the Gulf. The incident underscores the growing instability in the region, with geopolitical dynamics becoming increasingly complex. Observers are closely monitoring developments as the conflict continues to unfold, raising concerns about potential impacts on regional security and international relations.

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | Ukraine Expresses Solidarity Against Iran's Actions
data.description: Ukraine's Foreign Minister has declared the country's solidarity with Bahrain, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, and the United Arab Emirates in opposition to Iran's aggressive actions. According to Jin10, this statement underscores Ukraine's stance against what it perceives as reckless attacks by Iran. The move highlights the geopolitical tensions in the region and Ukraine's alignment with these Middle Eastern nations in response to Iran's activities.

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | Reports Suggest Possible Elimination of Iran's Supreme Leader Khamenei
data.description: A security source has indicated that there are increasing signs suggesting the elimination of Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei in an initial strike. According to Jin10, further confirmation is required to verify these claims. The situation remains tense as geopolitical implications could arise from such a development. Observers are closely monitoring the situation for any official statements or additional evidence that may emerge.
